rules.6x6: Place a digit from 1 to 6 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 2x3 outlined box. Adjacent cells marked with a white circle contain consecutive digits. Adjacent cells marked with a black circle contains digits where one digit is double of the other digit. The circle between 1 and 2 can be of either colour. All possible circles are not marked.
rules.9x9: Place a digit from 1 to 9 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 3x3 outlined box. Adjacent cells marked with a white circle contain consecutive digits. Adjacent cells marked with a black circle contains digits where one digit is double of the other digit. The circle between 1 and 2 can be of either colour. All possible circles are not marked.
